philosophies.name: Stoicism
philosophies.summary: Ancient Greek philosophy emphasizing ethics, logic, and living in harmony with nature. Focuses on cultivating self-control and fortitude to overcome destructive emotions.
philosophies.imagePrompt: A serene figure standing unmoved amidst a stormy sea, with a scroll of wisdom in hand, rendered in a hand-drawn, ancient Greek style.

philosophies.name: Taoism
philosophies.summary: Chinese philosophy emphasizing living in harmony with the Tao (the source and essence of everything). Promotes simplicity, spontaneity, and non-action.
philosophies.imagePrompt: A winding river flowing through a misty mountain landscape, with yin-yang symbols hidden in the natural elements, in a traditional Chinese brush painting style.

philosophies.name: Buddhism
philosophies.summary: Eastern philosophy focused on ending suffering through understanding the nature of reality, cultivating wisdom, and following the Eightfold Path.
philosophies.imagePrompt: A peaceful Buddha figure seated under a Bodhi tree, surrounded by lotus flowers and gentle light, in a hand-drawn mandala-inspired style.

philosophies.name: Islam
philosophies.summary: Monotheistic religion teaching submission to Allah (God) and following the teachings of Prophet Muhammad. Emphasizes faith, prayer, charity, and ethical living.
philosophies.imagePrompt: A beautifully detailed mosque with intricate geometric patterns, surrounded by people in prayer and acts of charity, in an Islamic calligraphy-inspired hand-drawn style.

philosophies.name: Christianity
philosophies.summary: Monotheistic religion based on the life and teachings of Jesus Christ. Emphasizes love, faith, forgiveness, and salvation through Christ.
philosophies.imagePrompt: A radiant cross on a hill, surrounded by diverse people helping each other, with doves and olive branches, in a stained-glass window inspired hand-drawn style.

philosophies.name: Hinduism
philosophies.summary: Ancient Indian religion and philosophy with diverse traditions. Emphasizes dharma (ethics and duties), karma (action and consequences), and moksha (liberation).
philosophies.imagePrompt: A cosmic wheel representing the cycle of life, death, and rebirth, adorned with Hindu deities and symbols, in a colorful hand-drawn mandala style.

philosophies.name: Confucianism
philosophies.summary: Ancient Chinese ethical and philosophical system developed by Confucius. Emphasizes personal and governmental morality, correctness of social relationships, and justice.
philosophies.imagePrompt: A harmonious garden with five intertwining trees representing the Five Constants (Wuchang): benevolence, righteousness, propriety, wisdom, and faithfulness. Each tree bears fruit symbolizing social harmony, with a golden thread connecting them all, illustrating the interconnectedness of virtues and relationships in society. The scene is rendered in a blend of traditional and modern artistic styles, emphasizing balance and order.

philosophies.name: Epicureanism
philosophies.summary: Ancient Greek philosophical system advocating for the pursuit of moderate pleasure and tranquility through knowledge, friendship, and virtuous living.
philosophies.imagePrompt: A group of friends sharing a simple meal in a garden, surrounded by symbols of learning and nature, in a classical Greek fresco-inspired hand-drawn style.

philosophies.name: Secular Humanism
philosophies.summary: Philosophical stance emphasizing the potential for good in humanity, ethical behavior based on reason, and the search for meaning without supernatural beliefs.
philosophies.imagePrompt: People of diverse backgrounds building a bridge together, with symbols of science, art, and justice incorporated into the structure, in a modern hand-drawn infographic style.

philosophies.name: Positive Psychology
philosophies.summary: Branch of psychology focusing on the cultivation of happiness, well-being, and human flourishing. Emphasizes strengths, positive experiences, and meaningful life.
philosophies.imagePrompt: A vibrant tree with leaves representing different positive emotions and strengths, with people climbing and flourishing among its branches, in a colorful hand-drawn style.

philosophies.name: Mindfulness
philosophies.summary: Practice of maintaining awareness of the present moment, often derived from Buddhist meditation techniques. Focuses on non-judgmental observation of thoughts and sensations.
philosophies.imagePrompt: A person seated in a lotus position, with thought bubbles gently floating away, surrounded by a mandala of everyday objects, in a zen-inspired hand-drawn style.

philosophies.name: Cognitive Behavioral Therapy (CBT)
philosophies.summary: Psychotherapeutic approach focusing on challenging and changing cognitive distortions and behaviors to improve emotional regulation and develop personal coping strategies.
philosophies.imagePrompt: A mind map showing the interconnection between thoughts, emotions, and behaviors, with arrows indicating the ability to influence each aspect, in a clean, hand-drawn infographic style.

philosophies.name: Virtue Ethics
philosophies.summary: Approach to ethics emphasizing the virtues or moral character, rather than duties, rules, or consequences. Focuses on cultivating excellence of character.
philosophies.imagePrompt: A person tending to a garden of various plants, each representing a different virtue (courage, wisdom, justice, etc.), in a classical hand-drawn allegory style.
